thread.title: Comment on Cory Johnson questionable for Thursday’s game by Doug Pelfrey's Facemask
thread.title_full: Comment on Cory Johnson questionable for Thursday’s game by Doug Pelfrey's Facemask

author: Doug Pelfrey's Facemask
title: Comment on Cory Johnson questionable for Thursday’s game by Doug Pelfrey's Facemask
text:
Posted in Football , Main | 2 Responses 
There was good injury news and bad injury news during Mark Stoops’ press conference today. First, the good. As we saw on the depth chart, Jordan Swindle will be back at left tackle after recovering from a nagging injury. Cole Mosier will be his backup. 
Now, the bad. Kicker Austin MacGinnis is day-to-day after getting banged up before the EKU game. Stoops said he’s “kicked lightly” during practice. Freshman linebacker Jordan Jones is questionable, as is senior defensive tackle Cory Johnson , who Stoops said got “rolled up in practice a bit” last week. That’s not good news considering Johnson is coming off two career games, but Stoops said if he’s not able to play, having Regie Meant back at full speed will help offset the loss. 
Regardless, heal up boys.   2 responses to “Cory Johnson questionable for Thursday’s game”  51   
N !!! 
We gotta get Mr. Miyagi to work on Cory and Austin. Doug Pelfrey's Facemask October 12, 2015 at 2:25   
Devastating if CJ can’t play. He’s been playing out of his mind.
